main_definition: An archaic or literary form of the word 'to', used primarily in phrases that convey a sense of completeness, finality, or dedication.

meanings_and_examples.example: I will unto you all my heart and soul.
The king did unto his subjects what was just and lawful.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To dedicate or commit oneself entirely to
meanings_and_examples.example: He devoted himself unto the service of others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a manner that implies completeness, finality, or totality
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher said unto her students: 'This is our last class together.'
